cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles east of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 135 miles southeast of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: slowly turning north, then north-northeast, tracking toward the Mississippi/Alabama coast and then inland across central Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama border (close to Gulfport/Biloxi – Dauphin Island area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: HURRICANE: Morgan City, LA to Navarre, FL (includes Mobile, AL).  STORM SURGE: Port Fourchon, LA to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected to begin Monday night; hurricane-force gusts (possibly sustained 74-100 mph) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday as the center passes near or just west of Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast peak inundation 6–9 ft above ground level for Ocean Springs MS to Dauphin Island AL, including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated amounts up to 24 inches, producing life-threatening flash flooding and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands, dangerous surf and rip currents, extended power outages, and possible channel shoaling/siltation in port approaches.
